results.title: Narritjin at Djarrakpi. Part 1 (A)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Narritjin Maymuru (A)”.
Narritjin Maymuru and his family are establishing a small settlement at Djarrakpi, an important Manggalili clan site on the northern head of Blue Mud Bay in the Northern Territory. Narritjin is a renowned artist and he and his family produce bark paintings and craft work to sell at Yirrkala. This program, together with Part 2 [507335], gives an insight into Narritjin’s family life and, through his paintings, his role as an educator, teaching his sons about their clan land and its ancestral history.

results.title: My country, Djarrakpi
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Narritjin Maymuru (A)”.
In this program, Narritjin Maymuru talks about his land at Djarrakpi, one of the most important sacred sites of his Manggalili clan. The film is set into two contrasting contexts. At an exhibition of his paintings at the Australian National University in Canberra, Narritjin explains the meaning behind a bark painting of Djarrakpi; then on the wind-swept sand dunes of Djarrakpi itself he explains the significance of some of the actual features of the landscape. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: My Sesame Street Home Video
results.creator_credit: Jon Stone and Children's Television Workshop
results.brief_description: Featuring Jim Henson’s muppets and the Sesame St. live cast this series includes favorite segments from Sesame St. as well as brand new material. Each video tackles one theme, such as counting, or parties and is accompanied by a book of activities, puzzles and songs.

results.title: My friend Hans from Germany
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “My Friend”.
Tells something of the life of Hans, a German boy living in the village of Garmisch-Partenkirchen near Munich in Bavaria. Shows the harvest season and the unusual tradition of sheltering cattle under houses. Throughout the year Hans goes skiing on the nearby Zugspitz Mountain.

results.title: Kyomi from Japan
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “My Friend”.
The story of Kyomi and her dream of becoming an “Ama” girl. Shows Japanese girls diving for oysters on the Mikimoto farm. When the nucleus is inserted the oysters are placed in wire cages and returned to the water on suspended rafts. They are lifted and cleaned several times before the pearls are harvested. Shows grading, weighing and stringing in the factory.

results.title: Om and Prom from Cambodia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “My Friends”.
A day in the life of two Cambodian boys. Shows them at school, at play, at home and working in the rice fields. They ride on elephants to the ruins of Angkor where they see the age-old ritual of the beautiful palace dancers.

group_works.title: The Genetic chance
group_works.creator_credit: Robert Reid and British Broadcasting Corporation

results.title: The Genetic chance
results.creator_credit: Robert Reid and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “My Children My Children”.
Examines the moral and social implications of determining genetic disorders in unborn infants, and looks at the effects of a number of such disorders. Most of the discussion is centred around haemophilia.

results.title: Tchaikovsky's Romeo and Juliet
results.creator_credit: George Freedland, George Richfield and Official Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Musical masterpieces”.
The Radio Philharmonic Orchestra of Italy, under the gaton of Fernando Previtali, perform Tchaikovsky’s romantic suite, “Romeo and Juliet”.
